[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_network_version()] [REST Client Trust] The aptos_rest_client is trusted to return correct version numbers - can client bugs or API changes cause incorrect versions to be locked? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Git2 Library Vulnerabilities] Can vulnerabilities in the git2 library (e.g., buffer overflows in C code) be triggered through malicious git URLs or revisions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [TOML Library Vulnerabilities] Can vulnerabilities in the toml serialization library be exploited through crafted PackageLock data structures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: load_from_file_or_empty()] [TOML Parser Vulnerabilities] Can parser bugs in the toml crate be exploited through maliciously crafted lock files to cause crashes or RCE? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [General] [Non-Deterministic Resolution] Can environmental factors (network timing, DNS ordering, git server responses) cause non-deterministic lock file generation even with identical inputs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Time-of-Resolution Attack] Can the timing of when dependencies are resolved affect which commit is locked, allowing time-based attacks where malicious commits are active during resolution windows? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_network_version()] [Version Pinning Bypass] Once a version is locked, is there any mechanism to detect if the actual package content at that version has changed (e.g., through rollback attacks on blockchain)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [General] [Lock File Verification] Is there any cryptographic signing or verification of lock files to detect tampering between when they're generated and when they're used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [General] [Reproducibility Guarantees] Does the lock file format guarantee that the same lock file will always produce identical build outputs, or can other factors cause non-deterministic builds? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Empty Rev] Can an empty string be passed as rev parameter, and does this cause undefined behavior or resolve to unexpected commits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Very Long Rev] Can extremely long rev strings (e.g., branch names with thousands of characters) cause buffer overflows or resource exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_network_version()] [Invalid URL] Can malformed URLs (e.g., missing scheme, invalid characters) bypass validation and cause panics or undefined behavior in the HTTP client? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [Empty Lock] Can an empty PackageLock (no dependencies) be serialized and deserialized correctly, or does this cause edge case errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: load_from_file_or_empty()] [Empty File] Does an empty file (zero bytes) correctly parse as an empty PackageLock, or does this cause deserialization errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Struct: PackageLock] [Maximum Entries] Can the BTreeMaps grow to contain millions of entries, and does this cause performance degradation or memory issues during serialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [Path Separator Issues] Can path handling cause issues on Windows vs Unix systems (backslash vs forward slash), leading to path traversal or incorrect file locations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [Line Ending Issues] Does TOML serialization use platform-specific line endings (CRLF vs LF), causing lock file differences between platforms and breaking git diffs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: load_from_file_or_empty()] [Encoding Issues] Can non-UTF8 encoded lock files cause parsing errors or data corruption when read by fs::read_to_string()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Case Sensitivity] Can case-insensitive filesystems (macOS, Windows) cause issues where git URLs differing only in case are treated as different dependencies? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Mutable Borrow Safety] Does taking &mut self prevent safe concurrent resolution, and could this be exploited to cause deadlocks or resource starvation in parallel builds? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_network_version()] [Mutable Borrow Safety] Similarly, does &mut self requirement force sequential resolution when parallel resolution could be safe with interior mutability? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [General] [Clone Cost] Are there unnecessary clones of large data structures that could be optimized with references, or can clone operations be exploited for DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Submodule Attacks] Does git resolution handle git submodules, and can malicious submodules bypass lock pinning to pull in unverified code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_git_revision()] [Tag vs Commit] Does the code distinguish between tags and commits, and can mutable tags (where tag can be moved to different commits) bypass lock integrity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/lock.rs] [Function: resolve_network_version()] [Chain Reorganization] If a blockchain undergoes reorganization after version is locked, can this cause package content at locked version to change? (Medium)
